case.description:
1) Gateway messages
There are four different messages which can be used to transmit data to heaters:
1a) Gateway request message type
Used to send external temperatures to heaters and ask for special requests.
graphics/D2-33-00_MID00.png

item.description: Question: sensor air flow, hygrometry, pressure and temperature

case.description:
1b) Sensor parameters
This command is transmitted by the gateway controller to enable/disable a sensor. If a sensor is disabled, no measurement will be taken and the corresponding data field will be set to 0 to indicate that the sensor is disabled.
For any fields that are not supported, as indicated in the VLD family table above, 0 shall be transmitted in the corresponding field of the sensor parameters message. Only the supported fields are valid for each EEP and the rest should be ignored on the heater side.
graphics/D2-33-00_MID01.png

datafield.description: Indicates if the open window detection is active
Indicates if the PIR function is active
Indicates which temperature has to be used
Indicate if COV sensor is active
Indicate if CO sensor is active
Indicate if CO2 sensor is active
Indicate if particles 1 sensor is active
Indicate if particles 2.5 sensor is active
Indicate if particles 10 sensor is active
Indicate if radio activity sensor is active
Indicate if sound sensor is active
Indicate if hygrometry sensor is active
Indicate if air moving sensor is active
Indicate if pressure sensor is active
Defines the used temperature scale for the room control panel display and menus
Indicates if the derogation is allowed

case.description:
1c) Program
Use to define scheduling (timeslot + setpoint temperature) for all week.
To set a continuous loop over several weeks with the same setpoint temperature (Non timed mode), the gateway must send the following configuration: (as Comfort/Reduce)
- Send in One time mode
- Monday 00:00 to Monday 00:00 (Start = Stop)
- Set point: in Celcius
If start time = stop time, the stop time isn’t taken into account and in this case the One time timeslot is a “forever” loop.
To send a full new weekly schedule, the gateway must sequentially send all timeslots with the desired setpoint temperature.
Priority: On Time information has higher priority than weekly information. In case of non-information for one time and weekly, the heater is in stop mode.
Warning: When both the CSC and TPT fields are set to 1, all scheduling programs (one time and weekly) of the heater are cleared.
graphics/D2-33-00_MID02.png

datafield.description: The end day to apply the provided scheduled order
The end time (minute) to apply the provided scheduled order
The end time (hour) to apply the provided scheduled order
The start day to apply the provided scheduled order
The start time (minute) to apply the provided scheduled order
The start time (hour) to apply the provided scheduled order

The temperature setpoint to apply
the provided scheduled order:
Setpoint(°C) = value / 10
Allow to clear Weekly or one time

case.description:
1d) Time and date
Use to define Time and date for heaters.
graphics/D2-33-00_MID03.png

2) Heater message
5 different messages to communicate data to Gateway:
2a) Request and status
Ask for special data from gateway and send actual status of product.
graphics/D2-33-00_MID08.png

item.description: Error between internal temp and external temp is greater than 4°C

datafield.description: Indicates if the heater is heating the room
Indicates the status of the pilot wire
Indicates if an open window is detected
Indicates if the PIR detected a movement
Indicates if the children protection is active or not
Indicates the status of the derogation

case.description:
2b) Heater parameters
Use by gateway to know Energy, Setpoint in derogation mode and firmware version.
graphics/D2-33-00_MID09.png

datafield.description:
Total amount of energy consumed
Energy(KWh) = value / 10

The temperature setpoint set with the derogation:
Setpoint(°C) = value / 10
Give the version of the firmware

case.description:
2c) Value of CO, COV, CO2 and sound level
Use by gateway to know value of CO, COV, CO2 and sound level.
graphics/D2-33-00_MID10.png

item.description: Value of CO, COV, CO2 and sound level

case.description:
2d) Value of particles and radioactivity sensors
Use by gateway to know value of particle and radioactivity.
graphics/D2-33-00_MID11.png

item.description: Value of particles and radioactivity sensors

case.description:
2e) Value of air flow, hygrometry, pressure and temperature
Use by gateway to know value of air flow, hygrometry, pressure and temperature.
graphics/D2-33-00_MID12.png

item.description: Value of air, hygro., pressure and temp.
